name: TOI-1130
scenarioDescription:
The TOI-1130 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-1130 is a star with 0.68 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.69 times its radius. It is located 190.34 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 8.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-1130 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-1130 system


TOI-1130 b

TOI-1130 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The radius of TOI-1130 b is 3.65 that of Earth.


TOI-1130 c

TOI-1130 c was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-1130 c is 309.73199999999997 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-1130 c is 16.814 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TOI-1130 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system TOI-1130, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
